author: Nistula Hebbar
text:
Senior Congress leader Ahmed Patel has written to Union Tribal Affairs Minister Jual Oram, alleging dilution of the Forest Rights Act (FRA), 2006 by his Ministry and the Maharashtra government, to benefit a few private firms.

The letter, dated January 19, says the Central government, by allowing the Maharashtra government “total control over forest management and disposal of forest produce”, diluted the FRA.

While the letter does not name any company, sources in the Congress say that the allusion is to Patanjali Products, run by Yoga guru Baba Ramdev. The Congress is hoping to corner the two governments on the issue.
title: Centre diluting Forest Rights Act: Congress
